meanings.definition: psychs: to mentally prepare or motivate oneself
meanings.sent1: Before the big game, he psychs himself up by listening to pump-up music.
meanings.sent2: She always psychs herself before giving a presentation to boost her confidence.
meanings.sent3: He psychs himself up so much that he accidentally started dancing in the waiting room.
meanings.sent4: The coach's pep talk really helped psych up the team for the championship game.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing success is a great way to psych yourself up for a challenging task.

meanings.definition: psychs: a shortened form of the word 'psychology'
meanings.sent1: She decided to major in psychs because she was fascinated by human behavior.
meanings.sent2: The textbook on psychs explained various theories of the mind.
meanings.sent3: His interest in psychs led him to volunteer at a mental health clinic.
meanings.sent4: The study of psychs helps us understand why people think and behave the way they do.
meanings.sent5: Learning about psychs has opened up a whole new world of understanding for her.

meanings.definition: psychs: a slang term for psychiatric medications
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed psychs to help manage his anxiety.
meanings.sent2: She always carries her psychs with her in case of a panic attack.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly referred to his pills as 'psychs' to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent4: Taking his psychs every day has helped him maintain a stable mental state.
meanings.sent5: The pharmacist explained the proper way to store psychs to ensure their effectiveness.
